org.bytedeco.flycapture.FlyCapture2

Class GigECamera

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bytedeco.javacpp.Pointer
      • org.bytedeco.flycapture.FlyCapture2.CameraBase
        • org.bytedeco.flycapture.FlyCapture2.GigECamera
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable

    @Namespace(value="FlyCapture2")
 @Properties(inherit=FlyCapture2.class)
public class GigECamera
extends CameraBase
    The GigECamera object represents a physical Gigabit Ethernet camera. The object must first be connected to using Connect() before any other operations can proceed. Please see Camera.h for basic functions that this class inherits from. \nosubgrouping

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class org.bytedeco.javacpp.Pointer

        Pointer.CustomDeallocator, Pointer.Deallocator, Pointer.NativeDeallocator, Pointer.ReferenceCounter

    • Field Summary

      • DiscoverGigEPacketSize

        @ByVal
public Error DiscoverGigEPacketSize(@Cast(value="unsigned int*")
                                            IntPointer packetSize)
        Discover the largest packet size that works for the network link between the PC and the camera. This is useful in cases where there may be multiple links between the PC and the camera and there is a possiblity of a component not supporting the recommended jumbo frame packet size of 9000.
        Parameters:
        packetSize - The maximum packet size supported by the link.
        Returns:
        An Error indicating the success or failure of the function.

        @ByVal
public Error SetGigEImageBinningSettings(@Cast(value="unsigned int")
                                                 int horzBinnningValue,
                                                 @Cast(value="unsigned int")
                                                 int vertBinnningValue)
        Set the specified binning values to the camera. It is recommended that GetGigEImageSettingsInfo() be called after this function succeeds to retrieve the new image settings information for the new binning mode.
        Parameters:
        horzBinnningValue - Horizontal binning value.
        vertBinnningValue - Vertical binning value.
        Returns:
        An Error indicating the success or failure of the function.

      • StartCapture

        @ByVal
public Error StartCapture(ImageEventCallback callbackFn,
                                  @Const
                                  Pointer pCallbackData)
        Description copied from class: CameraBase
        Starts isochronous image capture. It will use either the current video mode or the most recently set video mode of the camera. The optional callback function parameter is called on completion of image transfer. When a callback function is specified, the grab mode will determine how images are delivered. If the grab mode has not been set, or has been set to DROP_FRAMES the default behavior is to requeue images for DMA if they have not been delivered by the time the next image transfer completes. If BUFFER_FRAMES is specified, the next image in the sequence will be delivered. Note that for the BUFFER_FRAMES case, if delivery does not keep up with the DMA process, images will be lost. The default behavior is to perform DROP_FRAMES image delivery Alternatively, the callback parameter can be set to NULL and RetrieveBuffer() can be called as a blocking call to get the image data.
        Overrides:
        StartCapture in class CameraBase
        Parameters:
        callbackFn - A function to be called when a new image is received.
        pCallbackData - A pointer to data that can be passed to the callback function.
        Returns:
        An Error indicating the success or failure of the function.
        See Also:
        RetrieveBuffer(), StartSyncCapture(), CameraBase.StopCapture()

      • StartCapture

        @ByVal
public Error StartCapture()
        Overrides:
        StartCapture in class CameraBase

      • StartSyncCapture

        @ByVal
public static Error StartSyncCapture(@Cast(value="unsigned int")
                                             int numCameras,
                                             @Cast(value="const FlyCapture2::GigECamera**")
                                             PointerPointer ppCameras,
                                             @Cast(value="FlyCapture2::ImageEventCallback*") @ByPtrPtr
                                             ImageEventCallback pCallbackFns,
                                             @Cast(value="const void**")
                                             PointerPointer pCallbackDataArray)
        StartSyncCapture() with GigE Cameras is not supported. This function has been deprecated and will be removed in a future version of FlyCapture.

      • RetrieveBuffer

        @ByVal
public Error RetrieveBuffer(Image pImage)
        Description copied from class: CameraBase
        Retrieves the the next image object containing the next image. If the grab mode has not been set, or has been set to DROP_FRAMES the default behavior is to requeue images for DMA if they have not been retrieved by the time the next image transfer completes. If BUFFER_FRAMES is specified, the next image in the sequence will be retrieved. Note that for the BUFFER_FRAMES case, if retrieval does not keep up with the DMA process, images will be lost. The default behavior is to perform DROP_FRAMES image retrieval.
        Overrides:
        RetrieveBuffer in class CameraBase
        Parameters:
        pImage - Pointer to Image object to store image data.
        Returns:
        An Error indicating the success or failure of the function.
        See Also:
        CameraBase.StartCapture(), CameraBase.StopCapture()

      • StopCapture

        @ByVal
public Error StopCapture()
        Description copied from class: CameraBase
        Stops isochronous image transfer and cleans up all associated resources. If an image callback function (specified in the StartCapture() call) is currently executing, StopCapture() will not return until after the callback has completed.
        Overrides:
        StopCapture in class CameraBase
        Returns:
        An Error indicating the success or failure of the function.
        See Also:
        CameraBase.StartCapture(), RetrieveBuffer()

      • SetUserBuffers

        @ByVal
public Error SetUserBuffers(@Cast(value="unsigned char*const")
                                    BytePointer pMemBuffers,
                                    int size,
                                    int numBuffers)
        Description copied from class: CameraBase
        Specify user allocated buffers to use as image data buffers. To prevent image tearing, the size of each buffer should be equal to ((unsigned int)(bufferSize + packetSize - 1)/packetSize) * packetSize. The total size should be (size * numBuffers) or larger. The packet Size that should be used differs between interfaces: Firewire: Use the Format7 packet size. Usb2: First round to Format7 packet size then round to 512 bytes. Usb3: Use a packet size of 1024 bytes. GigE: No need to do any rounding on GigE
        Overrides:
        SetUserBuffers in class CameraBase
        Parameters:
        pMemBuffers - Pointer to memory buffers to be written to.
        size - The size of each buffer (in bytes).
        numBuffers - Number of buffers in the array.
        Returns:
        An Error indicating the success or failure of the function.
        See Also:
        CameraBase.StartCapture(), RetrieveBuffer(), CameraBase.StopCapture()

      • SetUserBuffers

        @ByVal
public Error SetUserBuffers(@Cast(value="unsigned char*const")
                                    ByteBuffer pMemBuffers,
                                    int size,
                                    int numBuffers)
        Overrides:
        SetUserBuffers in class CameraBase

      • WriteRegisterBlock

        @ByVal

                                        short addressHigh,
                                        @Cast(value="unsigned int")

                                        @Cast(value="const unsigned int*")
                                        IntPointer pBuffer,
                                        @Cast(value="unsigned int")
                                        int length)
        Description copied from class: CameraBase
        Write to the specified register block on the camera.
        Overrides:
        WriteRegisterBlock in class CameraBase
        Parameters:
        addressHigh - Top 16 bits of the 48 bit absolute address to write to.
        addressLow - Bottom 32 bits of the 48 bits absolute address to write to.
        pBuffer - Array containing data to be written.

        An Error indicating the success or failure of the function.
